content.description: ground start with a match on the only crystal hold, slowly stand on a tiny nub with your left foot into the corner, reach for a rough pinch with a tiny thumb catch, left hand to frictiony hold, dance feet to left for a toe hook, left hand to hold under supercamp massacre jug, right hand to crappy side pull under supuercamp massacre flake, move to toe hook on the right, high reach with right for crappy two finger hold, left hand on jug just above, finish the top of supuercamp massacreNOTE In Sept 2020 the original submitter of this route requested it be deleted, but agreed to have his name removed and for the route to be "reassigned", whereupon I "took it on".  R Hall NH Admin.
a fun traverse from the left side of the boulder and finishing with the problem "sunset traverse" at the right of the boulder
Start on the left side of the prow and traverse right. Climb through the corner and top out for Summer Camp. A link up of Supermoon into Summer Camp.
content.protection: A couple pads at least. Good flat landing.

content.description: Start the same as Sleeping Giant, Once you move left to the flake continue up and left under the prow. Make a long move onto the face above on good holds and keep a cool head for the top out.
content.location: On the main 14 foot overhanging prow.

content.description: Start with hands on the seam and a bad left foot. Pull up make a few moves to the flared horizontal and continue up to the tallest point. The start is the crux with a "fun" topout
content.location: On the boulder right of the overhanging prow.

content.description: Start on big flake (Lakeside Warmup) then dyno straight up to large sloper for top out. Fun and easy dyno.
content.location: Right of the prow on the big juggy flake of Lakeside Warmup.

content.description:
Start low on two jugs, left hand has 3 slopers/crimps to choose and bump on while right follows big flake. The crux is gaining the next two crimps and reaching the flake above to freedom. 

  Fun fun fun problem thats begs to be climbed. Not sure if it's been sent before or not. Cleaned fair amount of linchen off around arete and up top.
content.protection: Pad. Spotter would be nice as there is 2 trees and hill in landing area.
content.location: Just right of Summer Camp V2.

content.description: Start on the block with your feet and hands on the rail and crimps to traverse to the good hold. Finish up on the moves to SummerCAmp Massacre.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter.
content.location: On the left side of the overhanging prow.

content.description: A nice warmup for the other routes on these two boulders. Start sitting/crouching, left hand in the crack, right on a decent sidepull and move up into the flake and top out straight up
content.location: a few feet right of the overhanging prow. This climbs up the flakes and up and right.

content.description: walk down the hill from the over hanging large boulder and the one in the corner and walk down a path to the back side of a seemingly small boulder... the otherside holds a 15 foot highball boulder with a tree about two feet from the right side...  the boulder is relitivly clean and slabby right off the bat you should see a two finger pocket pretty close to the center work your way from the left side with a terrible crimp with a thumb catch and a opposing side pull up to a left hand juggy pocket from there move your right hand up to another side pull move your right hand into the centered two finger pocket then switch hands to your left hand in that same pocket... move right using shisty foot holds to a dyno righ to anothe sidepull crimp... get you right foot up and the crux and the sketchy ascent begin as you move your left hand up to a slopy ledge up high and use arete up with your right until you can dyno to the nice finish ...
content.protection: bring a pad or two... i went by myself ... and had one set in the middle of the boulder for the traverse moves right... then if i fell i would grab the tree behind me on the right side.... but two would be nice...
content.location: walk down the hill from the over hanging large boulder and the one in the corner and walk down a path to the back side of a seemingly small boulder... the otherside holds a 15 foot highball boulder with a tree about two feet from the right side...  the boulder is relitivly clean and slabby right off the bat you should see a two finger pocket pretty close to the center

content.description: Same start at Summercamp Massacre but instead of heading up the vertical crack to the top, find the undercling below the prow. From there make a big move directly to the apex of the prow. Top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  A blown move to the prow could result in a pretty bad fall into the boulder below.

content.description: Start sitting and move up to a good jug flake, Move left to a flake and then make a long love to the pockt and top out striaght up
content.protection: Pad or two and a spotter for the rock behind you.
content.location: on the larger boulder, climbing climbers right of the tall overhanging prow.

content.description: Start low right side with heel hook and both hands on a protruding flake. Follow roof left using slopers, crimps, heel hooks, and few good feet under roof. Gain furthest left arete and mantle this fun lowball.
content.location: Just feet below the 14' prow on a small boulder.

content.description: Follow beta from Roadside Attraction but once you are on the small pocket head left to the arete instead of right to finish up.  Super slab and bad feet. Have fun.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter for sure

content.description: Stand start the slab on the back left side around the corner from the tall face. There’s a couple ways to climb this. Stay left in the crack/runnel or smear out on the more blank section to the right. The latter is more of the v0 feel.
content.location: Around to the left of Highball Roadside Attraction.

content.description: Probably the most popular and frequented boulder at Rock Raymond/Lake Potanipo. A super nice overhang with a very prominent prow as well as a highball boulder just below it. The landings are mostly flat with a couple exceptions depending on the route you’re on. Easy walk off the backside.
